newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Nike sinks on outlook.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Nike sinks on outlook.

text.p: Nike Inc dropped in pre-opening trade Thursday after it forecast quarterly earnings below analysts' expectations, traders said.
The athletic shoe and clothing maker was trading at 54-7/8, down from its Wednesday close of 63-5/8.
Its preopening drop followed a jump of more than $3.50 Wednesday amid Wall Street speculation that billionaire investor Warren Buffett favored the company. The stock also had risen $3.75 on Tuesday.
"That is going to be the feature of the day," a trader said.
The Beaverton, Ore., company said early Thursday it expected fourth-quarter earnings of $0.51 to $0.56 a share, below analysts' consensus estimate of $0.69. The quarter ends Saturday.
The estimates included a one-time pre-tax charge of $0.04 a share related to a plant closing.
Merrill Lynch downgraded Nike to near-term neutral from accumulate, but kept the stock as a long-term buy.
Canadian beverage and entertainment company Seagram Co Ltd was at 39-1/2, up from its Wednesday close of 39-1/8. Seagram sold more than half its stake in Time Warner Inc Wednesday for $1.39 billion.
Time Warner was at 46-7/8, down from its 48-5/8 close.

Software publisher Novell Inc was at 7-1/8, down from a Wednesday close of 8-1/16. The Palo Alto, Calif., company reported an unexpected loss for the quarter following the markets' close Wednesday and said it planned to lay off 1,000 workers.
"They are kind of all over the tape. The numbers they reported are not good," a trader said.
Among other active stocks, First Union Real Estate Investments was at 12-5/8 from a Wednesday close of 12-3/4.
